title: Special Task Force to be housed in Colombo’s critical police stations
byline: Sri Lanka Police has taken a crucial decision to call in the services of its Special Task Force to back crime-fighting operations and house them at six critical police stations in Colombo, in a bid to counter the increasing wave of organised shootings, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: IMF agreement will be further reviewed soon to grant more concessions to people: Deputy Minister
byline: The government will review the IMF agreement to grant more concessions to the people, Deputy Minister of Fiance Harshana Sooriyaperuma told Parliament today.

title: Manusha arrives at CID
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago to provide a statement.

title: MP Archchuna involved in altercation with traffic police
byline: Jaffna District MP Archchuna Ramanathan was reportedly involved in an altercation with a group of police officers on traffic duty in the Rambewa area of Anuradhapura.

title: Cancer vaccine once sold at Rs. 76,000 reduced to Rs. 370
byline: In the wake of statements about a cancer vaccine that was once sold for Rs.76,000 now being reduced to Rs. 370, medical sources confirmed the authenticity of the story to the Daily Mirror.

title: Trump signs slew of executive actions after being sworn in
byline: President Trump on Monday signed a flurry of executive orders, memorandums and proclamations after his inauguration, reversing many of his predecessors’ policies and reinstating actions from his first term in office.

title: “It’s an act of revenge,” Namal says on AKD’s rent demand to MR
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is resorting to political revenge by suggesting that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa should pay the rent or leave his official residence in Wijerama Mawatha, MP Namal Rajapaksa said today.

title: Bribery Commission files 75 cases under new Anti-Corruption Act
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption announced that it has filed approximately 75 court cases under the newly enacted Anti-Corruption Act within the past nine months.

title: STF arrests suspect with ICE, cash in Hanwella
byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) arrested a suspect in Hanwella, seizing nearly two kilograms of ICE narcotic, valued at Rs. 35 million, along with Rs. 100,000 in cash.

title: Over 380 elephants killed in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka witnessed the death of 386 elephants in 2024 due to an array of causes, according to the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

title: Cabinet approval granted to provide Rs. 3,000 gift voucher for school children, student monks
byline: The Cabinet approved a Rs. 3,000 gift voucher for selected schoolchildren, student monks, and lay students in Pirivenas to purchase shoes and to Seela Mathas, Health and Mass Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Cabinet approves new appointments to key government posts
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers approved the appointment of two Commissioners to the Lands and Agriculture sectors and the Director General for the Department of Civil Defense.

title: Bi-partial civil aviation agreement between Sri Lanka, Italy
byline: The Cabinet approved a proposal to sign a bi-partial civil aviation agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Italy to operate air passenger services and air cargo services, Cabinet spoksman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Immigration official arrested for soliciting Rs. half-million bribe
byline: An immigration officer from the Department of Immigration and Emigration has been arrested for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 500,000 to secure the release of an individual detained over a visa violation.

title: Fire at ski resort hotel kills 10, injures 32
byline: A fire erupted early Tuesday at a hotel in a popular Turkish ski resort in the northwestern province of Bolu, killing 10 people and injuring 32,  Agence France-Presse reported, citing the interior ministry.

title: Ready to probe obtaining Rs. 50 mn to offer Parliamentary seat, if complained: Justice Minister
byline: A certain political party has obtained Rs. 50 million from a person to offer him a Parliamentary seat and the government is ready to investigate into it if a complaint is lodged, Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara said today.

title: Gammanpila questions President’s remarks on Trincomalee oil tanks
byline: Pivithuru Hela Urumaya leader Udaya Gammanpila has raised concerns over the President’s recent remarks in Katukurunda regarding the development of the 99 oil tanks in Trincomalee.

title: Court directs Tissa Attanayake to respond to PM’s defamation claim
byline: The Colombo District Court today directed the defendant parties, including Samagi Jana Balawegaya National Organiser Tissa Attanayake, to file answers in connection with a defamation case filed by Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Malinga unveils book titled ’Killer’
byline: Sri Lanka’s legendary fast bowler Lasith Malinga unveiled his maiden book, titled ’Killer’, at a grand launch event held in Colombo yesterday.

title: PTA needs to be used carefully until new Act is enacted: Bimal
byline: Claiming that enforcing the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) is not the policy of the government, Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Ratnayake said today that the PTA needs to be used carefully until a new Act is enacted.

title: Trump curtails protections around diversity, LGBTQ rights
byline: US President Donald Trump repealed numerous executive orders promoting LGBTQ equality and issued new ones decreeing only two genders and ending government diversity programs Monday, definitively breaking with what he decries as ’’woke’’ culture.

title: Government to make Rs. 1,437 mn budget allocation for coconut cultivation: Minister
byline: The government will allocate Rs. 1,437 million through the Budget 2025 for coconut cultivation in the northern coconut triangle, Plantation and Community Infrastructure Minister Samantha Vidyaratne said today.

title: Govt to provide vehicles to all 225 parliamentarians: Minister Herath
byline: The government will provide vehicles to all 225 parliamentarians for their use in the future, Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath said.

title: Why didn’t Trump place his hand on the Bible while taking oath?
byline: Donald Trump’s inauguration had to be moved indoors Monday due to a particularly frigid wintry spell across much of the United States, causing significant changes to the event after years of tedious planning.

title: Sri Lanka prove Super Six credentials at the U19WC 2025
byline: The Sri Lankans mean business at the ICC Women’s U19 World Cup, powering to an 81-run win over the West Indies in Kuala Lumpur set up by a history-making effort with the bat.

title: Adverse weather affects 20,000
byline: A total of 20,000 people from 6,797 families have been affected across fifteen districts due to natural disasters such as flash floods, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Is MP Archchuna in trouble? Police respond
byline: Sri Lanka Police have launched an investigation into Jaffna District MP Archchuna Ramanathan for allegedly disrupting police duties and violating traffic laws.

title: Studies to determine best way to restructure loss-making state institutions
byline: Studies are being carried out to determine the best way to restructure loss-making state institutions, Deputy Minister of Finance Harshana Sooriyaperuma told Parliament today.

title: Anura has forgotten I am Mahinda Rajapaksa - Ready to vacate at any time, - MR hits back hard at AKD
byline: I have seen it all. From political revenge to harassment, if the President feels my state house should be taken away from me, then I am ready to leave. Let him give me a written request

title: WHO ’regrets’ Trump decision to pull US from organisation
byline: The World Health Organization said Tuesday it regretted US President Donald Trump’s decision — just hours after taking power — to withdraw his country from the UN agency, saying it hoped he would ’’reconsider.’’

title: Why did Western Province Governor fund illumination of Galle Face during Christmas, asks MP
byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake questioned in Parliament today as to why Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof funded Christmas light displays at Galle Face and Duplication Road.

title: No evidence to prove I engaged in human trafficking: Manusha
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara said today that there is no evidence to prove he had engaged in human trafficking.

title: FCID to be launched next week: Public Security Minister
byline: The Financial Crime Investigation Division (FCID) will be established next week to handle cases related to financial crimes, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said in Parliament.

title: Mahinda facing mudslinging, but lions don’t whine: Ven. Saddatissa Thera
byline: A mudslinging campaign is underway against former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and everyone is saying that he is whining. But lions do not whine like puppies do, Ven. Iththakande Saddatissa thera said.

title: Several politicians linked to company which supplied Papaverine injection at higher prices: Nalinda
byline: Claiming that several polticians are linked to the comapny which had supplied Papaverine injection at an exorbinat price from 2019 to 2023, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today that an investigation will be conducted into the incident.

title: MP Archchuna Ramanathan to be arrested?
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court ordered the police to carry out further investigations into the incident involving MP Archchuna Ramanathan who allegedly obstructed the duties of police personnel in the Rambewa area of Anuradhapura, the police spokesman said.
